explanation_composer.regulatory_rule_cue:
Traffic Separation Scheme (TSS) applicability in the Baltic Sea near Rostock–Trelleborg and Travemünde–Trelleborg shipping lanes; applies to passenger vessels navigating within designated maritime corridors
Operational Protocol Rationale: Passenger vessels operating under way with no hazardous cargo typically follow predefined curved routes in structured waterways to maintain safe separation from opposing traffic and avoid subsea infrastructure. The observed stable speed, consistent course adjustment, and minimal heading variation indicate the vessel is navigating a gentle arc along a defined channel—consistent with standard routing measures in busy Baltic Sea transit zones. This behavior rules out anchoring, random maneuvering, or abrupt course changes, which would disrupt traffic flow or indicate distress. Instead, the gradual northeastward turn aligns with expected navigation through coordinated shipping lanes, where autopilot-assisted path following ensures compliance with international collision regulations and regional traffic management.
